inclusion.criterion: Resolution of all acute toxic effects of prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy or surgical procedures to NCI CTCAE Version 3.0 grade ≤1.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Adequate organ function as defined by the following criteria: Serum aspartate transaminase (AST; serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase [SGOT]) and serum alanine transaminase (ALT; serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase [SGPT]) ≤3 x local laboratory upper limit of normal (ULN), or AST and ALT ≤3 x ULN if liver function abnormalities are due to underlying malignancy.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients must have histologically or neuroradiographically recurrent anaplastic astrocytoma (AA) or glioblastoma (GBM). Must have had prior pathologic confirmation of primary tumor histology.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Must have a Karnofsky performance status (KPS) ≥ 60%
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Measurable disease per MacDonald criteria required using contrast enhanced cranial MRI.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Major surgery or radiation therapy within 4 weeks of starting study treatment.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: NCI CTCAE grade 3 hemorrhage within 4 weeks of starting study treatment.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of or known spinal cord compression or carcinomatous meningitis, or evidence of leptomeningeal disease on screening CT or MRI scan.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient is a 45-year-old man with a history of anaplastic astrocytoma of the spine complicated by severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention s/p Foley catheter, high-dose steroids, hypertension, and chronic pain.
